mailto:?subject=A%20New%20Chapter%20for%20Omid&body=%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/180863698576/a-new-chapter-for-omid%22%20class=%22tumblr_blog%22%3Eyahoodevelopers%3C/a%3E:%3C/p%3E%3Cblockquote%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ci%3EBy%20Ohad%20Shacham,%20Yonatan%20Gottesman,%20Edward%20Bortnikov%3Cbr/%3EScalable%20Systems%20Research,%20Verizon/Oath%3C/i%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://omid.incubator.apache.org/%22%3EOmid%3C/a%3E,%20an%20open%20source%20transaction%20processing%20platform%20for%20Big%20Data,%20was%20born%20as%20a%20research%20project%20at%20Yahoo%20(now%20part%20of%20Verizon),%20and%20became%20an%20Apache%20Incubator%20project%20in%202015.%20Omid%20complements%20Apache%20HBase,%20a%20distributed%20key-value%20store%20in%20Apache%20Hadoop%20suite,%20with%20a%20capability%20to%20clip%20multiple%20operations%20into%20logically%20indivisible%20(atomic)%20units%20named%20transactions.%20This%20programming%20model%20has%20been%20extremely%20popular%20since%20the%20dawn%20of%20SQL%20databases,%20and%20has%20more%20recently%20become%20indispensable%20in%20the%20NoSQL%20world.%20For%20example,%20it%20is%20the%20centerpiece%20for%20dynamic%20content%20indexing%20of%20search%20and%20media%20products%20at%20Verizon,%20powering%20a%20web-scale%20content%20management%20platform%20since%202015.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EToday,%20we%20are%20excited%20to%20share%20a%20new%20chapter%20in%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20history.%20Thanks%20to%20its%20scalability,%20reliability,%20and%20speed,%20Omid%20has%20been%20selected%20as%20transaction%20management%20provider%20for%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://phoenix.apache.org/%22%3EApache%20Phoenix%3C/a%3E,%20a%20real-time%20converged%20OLTP%20and%20analytics%20platform%20for%20Hadoop.%20Phoenix%20provides%20a%20standard%20SQL%20interface%20to%20HBase%20key-value%20storage,%20which%20is%20much%20simpler%20and%20in%20many%20cases%20more%20performant%20than%20the%20native%20HBase%20API.%20With%20Phoenix,%20big%20data%20and%20machine%20learning%20developers%20get%20the%20best%20of%20all%20worlds:%20increased%20productivity%20coupled%20with%20high%20scalability.%20Phoenix%20is%20designed%20to%20scale%20to%2010,000%20query%20processing%20nodes%20in%20one%20instance%20and%20is%20expected%20to%20process%20hundreds%20of%20thousands%20or%20even%20millions%20of%20transactions%20per%20second%20(tps).%20It%20is%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://phoenix.apache.org/who_is_using.html%22%3Ewidely%20used%20in%20the%20industry%3C/a%3E,%20including%20by%20Alibaba,%20Bloomberg,%20PubMatic,%20Salesforce,%20Sogou%20and%20many%20others.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20have%20just%20released%20a%20new%20and%20significantly%20improved%20version%20of%20Omid%20(1.0.0),%20the%20first%20major%20release%20since%20its%20original%20launch.%20We%20have%20extended%20the%20system%20with%20multiple%20functional%20and%20performance%20features%20to%20power%20a%20modern%20SQL%20database%20technology,%20ready%20for%20deployment%20on%20both%20private%20and%20public%20cloud%20platforms.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EA%20few%20of%20the%20significant%20innovations%20include:%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EProtocol%20re-design%20for%20low%20latency%20%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20early%20version%20of%20Omid%20was%20designed%20for%20use%20in%20web-scale%20data%20pipeline%20systems,%20which%20are%20throughput-oriented%20by%20nature.%20We%20re-engineered%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20internals%20to%20now%20support%20new%20ultra-low-latency%20OLTP%20(online%20transaction%20processing)%20applications,%20like%20messaging%20and%20algo-trading.%20The%20new%20protocol,%20Omid%20Low%20Latency%20(Omid%20LL),%20dissipates%20Omid%E2%80%99s%20major%20architectural%20bottleneck.%20It%20reduces%20the%20latency%20of%20short%20transactions%20by%205%20times%20under%20light%20load,%20and%20by%2010%20to%20100%20times%20under%20heavy%20load.%20It%20also%20scales%20the%20overall%20system%20throughput%20to%20550,000%20tps%20while%20remaining%20within%20real-time%20latency%20SLAs.%20The%20figure%20below%20illustrates%2 %20longer%20periods,%20discarding%20the%20original%20high-resolution%20data.%20OpenTSDB%20now%20supports%20storing%20and%20querying%20such%20data%20so%20that%20the%20raw%20data%20can%20expire%20from%20HBase%20or%20Bigtable,%20and%20the%20rollups%20can%20stick%20around%20longer.%20Querying%20for%20long%20time%20ranges%20will%20read%20from%20the%20lower%20resolution%20data,%20fetching%20fewer%20data%20points%20and%20speeding%20up%20queries.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ELikewise,%20when%20a%20user%20wants%20to%20query%20tens%20of%20thousands%20of%20time%20series%20grouped%20by,%20for%20example,%20data%20centers,%20the%20TSD%20will%20have%20to%20fetch%20and%20process%20a%20significant%20amount%20of%20data,%20making%20queries%20painfully%20slow.%20To%20improve%20query%20speed,%20pre-aggregated%20data%20can%20be%20stored%20and%20queried%20to%20fetch%20much%20less%20data%20at%20query%20time,%20while%20still%20retaining%20the%20raw%20data.%20We%20have%20an%20Apache%20Storm%20pipeline%20that%20computes%20these%20rollups%20and%20pre-aggregates,%20and%20we%20intend%20to%20open%20source%20that%20code%20in%202019.%20For%20more%20details,%20please%20visit%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://opentsdb.net/docs/build/html/user_guide/rollups.html%22%3Ehttp://opentsdb.net/docs/build/html/user_guide/rollups.html%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EHistograms%20and%20Sketches%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWhen%20monitoring%20or%20performing%20data%20analysis,%20users%20often%20like%20to%20explore%20percentiles%20of%20their%20measurements,%20such%20as%20the%2099.9th%20percentile%20of%20website%20request%20latency%20to%20detect%20issues%20and%20determine%20what%20consumers%20are%20experiencing.%20Popular%20metrics%20collection%20libraries%20will%20happily%20report%20percentiles%20for%20the%20data%20they%20collect.%20Yet%20while%20querying%20for%20the%20original%20percentile%20data%20for%20a%20single%20time%20series%20is%20useful,%20trying%20to%20query%20and%20combine%20the%20data%20from%20multiple%20series%20is%20mathematically%20incorrect,%20leading%20to%20errant%20observations%20and%20problems.%20For%20example,%20if%20you%20want%20the%2099.9th%20percentile%20of%20latency%20in%20a%20particular%20region,%20you%20can%E2%80%99t%20just%20sum%20or%20recompute%20the%2099.9th%20of%20the%2099.9th%20percentile.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20solve%20this%20issue,%20we%20needed%20a%20complex%20data%20structure%20that%20can%20be%20combined%20to%20calculate%20an%20accurate%20percentile.%20One%20such%20structure%20that%20has%20existed%20for%20a%20long%20time%20is%20the%20bucketed%20histogram,%20where%20measurements%20are%20sliced%20into%20value%20ranges%20and%20each%20range%20maintains%20a%20count%20of%20measurements%20that%20fall%20into%20that%20bucket.%20These%20buckets%20can%20be%20sized%20based%20on%20the%20required%20accuracy%20and%20the%20counts%20from%20multiple%20sources%20(sharing%20the%20same%20bucket%20ranges)%20combined%20to%20compute%20an%20accurate%20percentile.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EBucketed%20histograms%20can%20be%20expensive%20to%20store%20for%20highly%20accurate%20data,%20as%20many%20buckets%20and%20counts%20are%20required.%20Additionally,%20many%20measurements%20don%E2%80%99t%20have%20to%20be%20perfectly%20accurate%20but%20they%20should%20be%20precise.%20Thus%20another%20class%20of%20algorithms%20could%20be%20used%20to%20approximate%20the%20data%20via%20sampling%20and%20provide%20highly%20precise%20data%20with%20a%20fixed%20interval.%20Data%20scientists%20at%20Yahoo%20(now%20part%20of%20Oath)%20implemented%20a%20great%20Java%20library%20called%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://datasketches.github.io/%22%3EData%20Sketches%3C/a%3E%20that%20implements%20the%20Stochastic%20Streaming%20Algorithms%20to%20reduce%20the%20amount%20of%20data%20stored%20for%20high-throughput%20services.%20Sketches%20have%20been%20a%20huge%20help%20for%20the%20OLAP%20storage%20system%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://druid.io/%22%3EDruid%3C/a%3E%20(also%20sponsored%20by%20Oath)%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://bullet-db.github.io/%22%3EBullet%3C/a%3E,%20Oath%E2%80%99s%20open%20source%20real-time%20data%20query%20engine.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20latest%20TSDB%20version%20supports%20bucketed%20histograms,%20Data%20Sketches,%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/OpenTSDB/opentsdb-tdigests%22%3ET-Digests%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESome%20additional%20features%20include:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EHBase%20Date%20Tiered%20Compaction%20support%20to%20improve%20storage%20efficiency.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EA%20new%20authentication%20plugin%20interface%20to%20support%20enterprise%20use%20cases.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EAn%20interface%20to%20support%20fetching%20data%20directly%20from%20Bigtable%20or%20HBase%20rows%20using%20a%20search%20index%20such%20as%20ElasticSearch.%20This%20improves%20queries%20for%20small%20subsets%20of%20high%20cardinality%20data%20and%20we%E2%80%99re%20working%20on%20open%20sourcing%20our%20code%20for%20the%20ES%20schema.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EGreater%20UID%20cache%20controls%20and%20an%20optional%20LRU%20implementation%20to%20reduce%20the%20amount%20of%20JVM%20heap%20allocated%20to%20UID%20to%20string%20mappings.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EConfigurable%20query%20size%20and%20time%20limits%20to%20avoid%20OOMing%20a%20JVM%20with%20large%20queries.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3ETry%20the%20releases%20on%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/OpenTSDB/opentsdb/releases%22%3EGitHub%3C/a%3E%20and%20let%20us%20know%20of%20any%20issues%20you%20run%20into%20by%20posting%20on%20GitHub%20issues%20or%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/opentsdb%22%3EOpenTSDB%20Forum%3C/a%3E.%20Your%20feedback%20is%20appreciated!%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EOpenTSDB%203.0%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAdditionally,%20we%E2%80%99ve%20started%20on%203.0,%20which%20is%20a%20rewrite%20that%20will%20support%20a%20slew%20of%20new%20features%20including:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3EQuerying%20and%20analyzing%20data%20from%20the%20plethora%20of%20new%20time%20series%20stores.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EA%20fully%20configurable%20query%20graph%20that%20allows%20for%20complex%20queries%20OpenTSDB%201x%20and%202x%20couldn%E2%80%99t%20support.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EStreaming%20results%20to%20improve%20the%20user%20experience%20and%20avoid%20overwhelming%20a%20single%20query%20node.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EAdvanced%20analytics%20including%20support%20for%20time%20series%20forecasting%20with%20Yahoo%E2%80%99s%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/egads%22%3EEGADs%3C/a%3E%20library.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3EPlease%20join%20us%20in%20testing%20out%20the%20current%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://opentsdb.net/docs/3x/build/html/index.html%22%3E3.0%3C/a%3E%20code,%20reporting%20bugs,%20and%20adding%20features.%3C/p%3E%3C/blockquote%3E,https://yahooeng.tumblr.com/post/181461332311

g%20documents%20and%20relies%20upon%20matching%20keywords%20to%20terms%20in%20a%20collection%20of%20documents%20to%20surface%20relevant%20content%20at%20query%20time.%20In%20contrast,%20Search%202.0%20relies%20upon%20%E2%80%9Cembeddings%E2%80%9D%20rather%20than%20documents,%20and%20k-nearest-neighbors%20retrieval%20rather%20than%20term%20matching%20to%20surface%20relevant%20content.%20The%20programmer%20does%20not%20directly%20specify%20the%20map%20from%20content%20to%20embeddings.%20Instead,%20the%20programmer%20specifies%20how%20this%20map%20is%20derived%20from%20data.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThink%20of%20embeddings%20as%20points%20in%20a%20high-dimensional%20space%20that%20are%20used%20to%20represent%20some%20piece%20of%20content%20or%20metadata.%20In%20a%20Search%202.0%20system,%20embeddings%20lying%20close%20to%20each%20other%20in%20this%20space%20are%20more%20highly%20%E2%80%9Crelated%E2%80%9D%20or%20%E2%80%9Crelevant%E2%80%9D%20than%20points%20that%20are%20far%20apart.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221674%22%20data-orig-height=%22658%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/4148253191e504460b88e42646d81022/tumblr_inline_pr5f65By871wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221674%22%20data-orig-height=%22658%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EInstead%20of%20parsing%20a%20query%20for%20specific%20terms%20and%20then%20matching%20for%20those%20terms%20in%20our%20document%20index,%20a%20Search%202.0%20system%20would%20encode%20the%20query%20into%20an%20embedding%20space%20and%20retrieve%20the%20data%20associated%20with%20nearby%20embeddings.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPrototrain-ranker%20provides%20two%20things:%20(1)%20a%20%E2%80%9Cranker%E2%80%9D%20model%20for%20mapping%20content%20to%20embeddings%20and%20performing%20search,%20and%20(2)%20our%20%E2%80%9Cprototrain%E2%80%9D%20framework%20for%20training%20prototype%20machine%20learning%20models%20like%20our%20ranker%20Search%202.0%20system.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EWhy%20Search%202.0%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWhether%20we%E2%80%99re%20searching%20over%20videos,%20images,%20text,%20or%20other%20media,%20we%20can%20represent%20each%20type%20of%20data%20as%20an%20embedding%20using%20the%20proper%20deep%20learning%20techniques.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ERepresenting%20metadata%20as%20embeddings%20in%20high-dimensional%20space%20opens%20up%20the%20world%20of%20search%20to%20the%20powerful%20machinery%20of%20deep%20learning%20tools.%3Cb%3E%20%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20can%20learn%20ranking%20functions%20and%20directly%20encode%20%E2%80%9Crelevance%E2%80%9D%20into%20embeddings,%20avoiding%20the%20need%20for%20brittle%20and%20hand-engineered%20ranking%20functions.%20For%20example,%20it%20would%20be%20error-prone%20and%20tedious%20to%20program%20a%20Search%201.0%20search%20engine%20to%20respond%20to%20queries%20like%20%E2%80%9Cimages%20with%20a%20red%20bird%20in%20the%20upper%20right-hand%20corner%E2%80%9D.%20Certainly%20one%20could%20build%20specific%20classifiers%20for%20each%20one%20of%20these%20attributes%20(color,%20object,%20location)%20and%20index%20them.%20But%20each%20individual%20classifier%20and%20rule%20to%20parse%20the%20results%20would%20take%20work%20to%20build%20and%20test,%20with%20any%20new%20attribute%20entailing%20additional%20work%20and%20opportunities%20for%20errors%20and%20brittleness.%20Instead%20one%20could%20build%20a%20Search%202.0%20system%20by%20obtaining%20pairs%20of%20images%20and%20descriptions%20that%20directly%20capture%20one%E2%80%99s%20notion%20of%20%E2%80%9Crelevance%E2%80%9D%20to%20train%20an%20end-to-end%20ranking%20model.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20flexibility%20of%20this%20approach%20&ndash;%20defining%20relevance%20as%20an%20abstract%20distance%20using%20examples%20rather%20than%20potentially%20brittle%20rules%20&ndash;%20allows%20several%20other%20capabilities%20in%20a%20straightforward%20manner.%20These%20capabilities%20include%20multi-modal%20input%20(e.g.%20text%20with%20an%20image),%20interpolating%20between%20queries%20(%E2%80%9Csomething%20between%20this%20sofa%20and%20that%20one%E2%80%9D),%20and%20conditioning%20a%20query%20(%E2%80%9Ca%20dress%20like%20this,%20but%20in%20any%20color%E2%80%9D).%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EReframing%20search%20as%20a%20nearest-neighbor%20retrieval%20also%20has%20other%20benefits.%20We%20separate%20the%20process%20of%20ranking%20from%20the%20process%20of%20storing%20data.%20In%20doing%20so,%20we%20are%20able%20to%20reduce%20rules%20and%20logic%20of%20Search%201.0%20matching%20and%20ranking%20into%20a%20portable%20matrix%20multiplication%20routine.%20This%20makes%20the%20search%20engine%20massively%20parallel%20and%20allows%20it%20to%20take%20advantage%20of%20GPU%20hardware%20which%20has%20been%20optimized%20over%20decades%20to%20efficiently%20execute%20matrix%20multiplication.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EWhy%20we%20open%20sourced%20prototrain-ranker%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20code%20we%20open%20source%20today%20enables%20a%20key%20component%20in%20the%20Search%202.0%20system.%20It%20allows%20one%20to%20%E2%80%9Clearn%E2%80%9D%20embeddings%20by%20defining%20pairs%20of%20relevant%20and%20irrelevant%20data%20items.%20We%20provide%20as%20an%20example%20the%20necessary%20processing%20to%20train%20the%20model%20on%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://cvgl.stanford.edu/projects/lifted_struct/%22%3EStanford%20Online%20Products%20dataset%3C/a%3E,%20which%20provides%20multiple%20images%20of%20each%20of%20the%20thousands%20of%20products.%20The%20notion%20of%20relevance%20here%20is%20that%20two%20images%20contain%20the%20same%20item.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20also%20use%20the%20prototrain%20framework%20for%20training%20other%20machine%20learning%20models%20such%20as%20image%20classifiers.%20You%20can%20too.%20Please%20check%20out%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Prototrain%22%3Eframework%3C/a%3E%20and/or%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Prototrain/tree/master/models/ranker%22%3Eranker%20model%3C/a%3E.%20We%20hope%20you%20will%20have%20questions%20or%20comments,%20and%20will%20want%20to%20contribute%20to%20the%20project.%20Engage%20with%20us%20via%20GitHub%20or%20%3Ca%20href=%22mailto:%20eric.mcvoy.dodds@verizonmedia.com%22%3Eemail%3C/a%3E%20directly%20if%20you%20have%20questions.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E,https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/184928541358

3EIn%20this%20blog%20post,%20we%20are%20going%20to%20discuss%20two%20important%20characteristics%20of%20Apache%20Pulsar,%20%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3Emulti-tenancy%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3E%20and%20%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3Eadoption%20of%20next-generation%20storage%20technologies%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3E%20like%20NVMe%20and%20Persistent%20memory%20to%20achieve%20optimum%20performance%20with%20very%20low-cost%20overhead.%20We%20will%20also%20discuss%20benchmark%20testing%20of%20Apache%20Pulsar%20with%20persistent%20memory%20that%20shows%20we%20have%20achieved%205x%20more%20throughput%20with%20Persistent%20memory%20and%20also%20reduced%20the%20overall%20cost%20of%20the%20storage%20cluster.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3EWhat%20is%20Multi-Tenancy?%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EMulti-tenancy%20can%20be%20easily%20understood%20with%20the%20real-estate%20analogy%20and%20by%20understanding%20the%20difference%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3E%20between%20an%20apartment%20building%20and%20a%20single%20residence%20home.%20In%20apartment%20buildings,%20resources%20(exterior%20wall,%20utility,%20etc.)%20are%20shared%20among%20multiple%20tenants%20whereas%20in%20a%20single%20residence%20only%20one%20tenant%20consumes%20all%20resources%20of%20the%20house.%20When%20we%20use%20this%20analogy%20in%20technology,%20it%20describes%20multi-tenancy%20in%20a%20single%20instance%20of%20hardware%20or%20software%20that%20has%20more%20than%20one%20resident.%20And%20it's%20important%20that%20all%20residents%20on%20a%20shared%20platform%20operate%20their%20services%20without%20impacting%20each%20other.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EApache%20Pulsar%20has%20an%20architecture%20distinct%20from%20other%20messaging%20systems.%20There%20is%20a%20clear%20separation%20between%20the%20compute%20layer%20(which%20does%20message%20processing%20and%20dispatching)%20and%20the%20storage%20layer%20(that%20handles%20persistent%20storage%20for%20messages%20using%20Apache%20BookKeeper).%20In%20BookKeeper,%20bookies%20(individual%20BookKeeper%20storage%20nodes)%20are%20designed%20to%20use%20three%20separate%20I/O%20paths%20for%20writes,%20tailing%20reads,%20and%20backlog%20reads.%20Separating%20these%20paths%20is%20important%20because%20writes%20and%20tailing%20reads%20use-cases%20require%20predictable%20low%20latency%20while%20throughput%20is%20more%20important%20for%20backlog%20reads%20use%20cases.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EReal-time%20applications%20such%20as%20databases%20and%20mission-critical%20online%20services%20need%20predictable%20low%20latency.%20These%20systems%20depend%20on%20low-latency%20messaging%20systems.%20In%20most%20messaging%20systems,%20under%20normal%20operating%20conditions,%20dispatch%20of%20messages%20occurs%20from%20in-memory%20caches.%20But%20when%20a%20message%20consumer%20falls%20behind,%20multiple%20interdependent%20factors%20get%20triggered.%20The%20first%20is%20storage%20backlog.%20Since%20the%20system%20guarantees%20delivery,%20messages%20need%20to%20be%20persistently%20stored%20until%20delivery,%20and%20a%20slow%20reader%20starts%20building%20a%20storage%20backlog.%20Second,%20when%20the%20slow%20consumer%20comes%20back%20online,%20it%20starts%20to%20consume%20messages%20from%20where%20it%20left%20off.%20Since%20this%20consumer%20is%20now%20behind,%20and%20older%20messages%20have%20been%20aged%20out%20of%20the%20in-memory%20cache,%20messages%20need%20to%20be%20read%20back%20from%20disk%20storage,%20and%20cold%20reads%20on%20the%20message%20store%20will%20occur.%20This%20backlog%20reads%20on%20the%20storage%20device%20will%20cause%20I/O%20contention%20with%20writes%20to%20persist%20incoming%20messages%20to%20storage%20getting%20published%20currently.%20This%20leads%20to%20general%20performance%20degradation%20for%20both%20reads%20and%20writes.%20In%20a%20system%20that%20handles%20many%20independent%20message%20topics,%20the%20backlog%20scenario%20is%20even%20more%20relevant,%20as%20backlogged%20topics%20will%20cause%20unbalanced%20storage%20across%20topics%20and%20I/O%20contention.%20Slow%20consumers%20force%20the%20storage%20system%20to%20read%20the%20data%20from%20the%20persistent%20storage%20medium,%20which%20could%20lead%20to%20I/O%20thrashing%20and%20page%20cache%20swap-in-and-out.%20This%20is%20worse%20when%20the%20storage%20I/O%20component%20shares%20a%20single%20path%20for%20writes,%20caught-up%20reads,%20and%20backlog%20reads.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EA%20true%20test%20of%20any%20messaging%20system%20should%20be%20a%20test%20of%20how%20it%20performs%20under%20backlog%20conditions.%20In%20general,%20published%20throughput%20benchmarks%20don't%20seem%20to%20account%20for%20these%20conditions%20and%20tend%20to%20produce%20wildly%20unrealistic%20numbers%20that%20cannot%20be%20scaled%20or%20related%20to%20provisioning%20a%20production%20system.%20Therefore,%20the%20benchmark%20testing%20that%20we%20are%20presenting%20in%20this%20blog%20is%20performed%20with%20random%20cold%20reads%20by%20draining%20backlog%20across%20multiple%20topics.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch3%3E%3Cspan%3EBookKeeper%20and%20I/O%20Isolation%3C/span%3E%3C/h3%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EApache%20BookKeeper%20stores%20log%20streams%20as%20segmented%20ledgers%20in%20bookie%20hosts.%20These%20segments%20(ledgers)%20are%20replicated%20to%20multiple%20bookies.%20This%20maximizes%20data%20placement%20options,%20which%20yields%20several%20benefits,%20such%20as%20high%20write%20availability,%20I/O%20load%20balancing,%20and%20a%20simplified%20operational%20experience.%20Bookies%20manage%20data%20in%20a%20log-structured%20way%20using%20three%20types%20of%20files:%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJournal%20%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3Econtains%20BookKeeper%20transaction%20logs.%20Before%20any%20update%20to%20a%20ledger%20takes%20place,%20the%20bookie%20ensures%20that%20a%20transaction%20describing%20the%20update%20is%20written%20to%20non-volatile%20storage.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EEntry%20log%20(Data-File)%20%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3Eaggregates%20entries%20from%20different%20ledgers%20(topics)%20and%20writes%20sequentially%20and%20asynchronously.%20It%20is%20also%20known%20as%20Data%20File.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EEntry%20log%20index%20%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3Emanages%20an%20index%20of%20ledger%20entries%20so%20that%20when%20a%20reader%20wants%20to%20read%20an%20entry,%20the%20BookKeeper%20locates%20the%20entry%20in%20the%20appropriate%20entry%20log%20and%20offset%20using%20this%20index.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWith%20two%20separate%20file%20systems,%20Journal%20and%20Data-file,%20BookKeeper%20is%20designed%20to%20use%20separate%20I/O%20paths%20for%20writes,%20caught-up%20reads,%20and%20backlog%20reads.%20BookKeeper%20does%20sequential%20writes%20into%20journal%20files%20and%20performs%20cold%20reads%20from%20data%20files%20for%20the%20backlog%20draining.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Figure%201:%20Pulsar%20I/O%20Isolation%20Architecture%20Diagram%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%226d98bffa-c685-4441-bcf3-973b1f108dc0%22%20height=%22395%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/image3_2.png%22%20width=%22553%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E[Figure%201:%20Pulsar%20I/O%20Isolation%20Architecture%20Diagram]%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3EAdoption%20of%20Next-Generation%20Storage%20Technologies%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EIn%20the%20last%20decade,%20storage%20technologies%20have%20evolved%20with%20different%20types%20of%20devices%20such%20as%20HDD,%20SSD,%20NVMe,%20persistent%20memory,%20etc.%20and%20we%20have%20been%20using%20these%20technologies%20for%20Pulsar%20storage%20as%20time%20changes.%20Adoption%20of%20the%20latest%20technologies%20is%20helpful%20in%20Pulsar%20to%20enhance%20system%20performance%20but%20it%E2%80%99s%20also%20important%20to%20design%20a%20system%20that%20can%20fully%20use%20a%20storage%20device%20based%20on%20its%20characteristics%20and%20squeeze%20the%20best%20performance%20out%20of%20each%20kind%20of%20storage.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ETable%202.%20shows%20how%20each%20device%20can%20fit%20into%20the%20BookKeeper%20model%20to%20achieve%20optimum%20performance.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22BookKeeper%20adaptation%20based%20on%20characteristics%20of%20storage%20devices%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%22077c6e10-a6d5-4a2f-b1cc-c1c7fca6a2ba%22%20height=%22313%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-10%20at%203.21.59%20PM.png%22%20width=%22640%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E&nbsp;[Table%202:%20BookKeeper%20adaptation%20based%20on%20characteristics%20of%20storage%20devices]%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EHard%20Disk%20Drive%20(HDD)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EFrom%20the%2080s%20until%20a%20couple%20of%20years%20ago,%20database%20systems%20have%20relied%20on%20magnetic%20disks%20as%20secondary%20storage.%20The%20primary%20advantages%20of%20a%20hard%20disk%20drive%20are%20affordability%20from%20a%20capacity%20perspective%20and%20reasonably%20good%20sequential%20performance.%20As%20we%20have%20already%20discussed,%20bookies%20append%20transactions%20to%20journals%20and%20always%20write%20to%20journals%20sequentially.%20So,%20a%20bookie%20can%20use%20hard%20disk%20drives%20(HDDs)%20with%20a%20RAID%20controller%20and%20a%20battery-backed%20write%20cache%20to%20achieve%20writes%20at%20lower%20latency%20than%20latency%20expectations%20from%20a%20single%20HDD.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EBookie%20also%20writes%20entry%20log%20files%20sequentially%20to%20the%20data%20device.%20Bookies%20do%20random%20reads%20when%20multiple%20Pulsar%20topics%20are%20trying%20to%20read%20backlogged%20messages.%20So,%20in%20total,%20there%20will%20be%20an%20increased%20I/O%20load%20when%20multiple%20topics%20read%20backlog%20messages%20from%20bookies.%20Having%20journal%20and%20entry%20log%20files%20on%20separate%20devices%20ensures%20that%20this%20read%20I/O%20is%20isolated%20from%20writes.%20Thus%20Pulsar%20can%20always%20achieve%20higher%20effective%20throughput%20and%20low%20latency%20writes%20with%20HDDs.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThere%20are%20other%20messaging%20systems%20that%20use%20a%20single%20file%20to%20write%20and%20read%20data%20for%20a%20given%20stream.%20Such%20systems%20have%20to%20do%20a%20lot%20of%20random%20reads%20if%20consumers%20from%20multiple%20streams%20start%20reading%20backlog%20messages%20at%20the%20same%20time.%20In%20a%20multi-tenant%20environment,%20it%E2%80%99s%20not%20feasible%20for%20such%20systems%20to%20use%20HDDs%20to%20achieve%20consistent%20low-write%20latency%20along%20with%20backlog%20consumer%20reads%20because%20in%20HDD,%20random%20reads%20can%20directly%20impact%20both%20write%20and%20read%20latencies%20and%20eventually%20writes%20have%20to%20suffer%20due%20to%20random%20cold%20reads%20on%20the%20disk.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ESATA%20Solid%20State%20Drives%20(SSD)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ESolid-state%20disks%20(SSD)-based%20on%20NAND%20flash%20media%20have%20transformed%20the%20performance%20characteristics%20of%20secondary%20storage.%20SSDs%20are%20built%20from%20multiple%20individual%20flash%20chips%20wired%20in%20parallel%20to%20deliver%20tens%20of%20thousands%20of%20IOPS%20and%20latency%20in%20the%20hundred-microsecond%20range,%20as%20opposed%20to%20HDDs%20with%20hundreds%20of%20IOPS%20and%20latencies%20in%20milliseconds.%20Our%20experience%20(Figure%203)%20shows%20that%20SSD%20provides%20higher%20throughput%20and%20better%20latency%20for%20sequential%20writes%20compared%20to%20HDDs.%20We%20have%20seen%20significant%20bookie%20throughput%20improvements%20by%20replacing%20SSDs%20with%20HDD%20for%20just%20journal%20devices.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ENon-Volatile%20Memory%20Express%20(NVMe)%20SSD%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ENon-Volatile%20Memory%20Express%20(NVMe)%20is%20another%20of%20the%20current%20technology%20industry%20storage%20choices.%20The%20reason%20is%20that%20NVMe%20creates%20parallel,%20low-latency%20data%20paths%20to%20underlying%20media%20to%20provide%20substantially%20higher%20performance%20and%20lower%20latency.%20NVMe%20can%20support%20multiple%20I/O%20queues,%20up%20to%2064K%20with%20each%20queue%20having%2064K%20entries.%20So,%20NVMe%E2%80%99s%20extreme%20performance%20and%20peak%20bandwidth%20will%20make%20it%20the%20protocol%20of%20choice%20for%20today%E2%80%99s%20latency-sensitive%20applications.%20However,%20in%20order%20to%20fully%20utilize%20the%20capabilities%20of%20NVMe,%20an%20application%20has%20to%20perform%20parallel%20I/O%20by%20spreading%20I/O%20loads%20to%20parallel%20processes.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWith%20BOOKKEEPER-963%20[2],%20the%20bookie%20can%20be%20configured%20with%20multiple%20journals.%20Each%20individual%20thread%20sequentially%20writes%20to%20its%20dedicated%20journal.%20So,%20bookies%20can%20write%20into%20multiple%20journals%20in%20parallel%20and%20achieve%20parallel%20I/O%20based%20on%20NVMe%20capabilities.%20Pulsar%20performs%202x-3x%20better%20with%20NVMe%20compared%20to%20SATA/SAS%20drives%20when%20the%20bookie%20is%20configured%20to%20write%20to%20multiple%20journals.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EPersistent%20Memory%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThere%20is%20a%20large%20performance%20gap%20between%20DRAM%20memory%20technology%20and%20the%20highest-performing%20block%20storage%20devices%20currently%20available%20in%20the%20form%20of%20solid-state%20drives.%20This%20gap%20can%20be%20reduced%20by%20a%20novel%20memory%20module%20solution%20called%20Intel%20Optane%20DC%20Persistent%20Memory&nbsp;(DCPMM)%20[1].%20The%20DCPMM%20is%20a%20byte-addressable%20cache%20coherent%20memory%20module%20device%20that%20exists%20on%20the%20DDR4%20memory%20bus%20and%20permits%20Load/Store%20accesses%20without%20page%20caching.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EDCPMM%20is%20a%20comparatively%20expensive%20technology%20on%20unit%20storage%20cost%20to%20use%20for%20the%20entirety%20of%20durable%20storage.%20However,%20BookKeeper%20provides%20a%20near-perfect%20option%20to%20use%20this%20technology%20in%20a%20very%20cost-effective%20manner.%20Since%20the%20journal%20is%20short-lived%20and%20does%20not%20demand%20much%20storage,%20a%20small-sized%20DCPMM%20can%20be%20leveraged%20as%20the%20journal%20device.%20Since%20journal%20entries%20are%20going%20to%20be%20ultimately%20flushed%20to%20ledgers,%20the%20size%20of%20the%20journal%20device%20and%20hence%20the%20amount%20of%20persistent%20memory%20needed%20is%20in%20the%20tens%20of%20GB.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EAdding%20a%20small%20capacity%20DCPMM%20on%20bookie%20increases%20the%20total%20cost%20of%20bookie%205%20-%2010%,%20but%20it%20gives%20significantly%20better%20performance%20by%20giving%20more%20than%205x%20throughput%20while%20maintaining%20low%20write%20latency.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EEndurance%20Considerations%20of%20Persistent%20Memory%20vs%20SSD%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EDue%20to%20the%20guarantees%20needed%20on%20the%20data%20persistence,%20journals%20need%20to%20be%20synced%20often.%20On%20a%20high-performance%20Pulsar%20cluster,%20with%20SSDs%20as%20the%20journal%20device%20to%20achieve%20lower%20latencies,%20this%20eats%20into%20the%20endurance%20budget,%20thus%20shortening%20the%20useful%20lifespan%20of%20NAND%20flash-based%20media.%20So%20for%20high%20performance%20and%20low%20latency%20Pulsar%20deployment,%20storage%20media%20needs%20to%20be%20picked%20carefully.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThis%20issue%20can,%20however,%20be%20easily%20addressed%20by%20taking%20advantage%20of%20persistent%20memory.%20Persistent%20memory%20has%20significantly%20higher%20endurance,%20and%20the%20write%20throughput%20required%20for%20a%20journal%20should%20be%20handled%20by%20this%20device.%20A%20small%20amount%20of%20persistent%20memory%20is%20cheaper%20than%20an%20SSD%20with%20equivalent%20endurance.%20So%20from%20the%20endurance%20perspective,%20Pulsar%20can%20take%20advantage%20of%20persistent%20memory%20technology%20at%20a%20lower%20cost.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Latency%20vs%20throughput%20with%20different%20journal%20device%20in%20bookie%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%22182bd7a9-72eb-4deb-8f16-986c2e506ae8%22%20height=%22359%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/image6_0.png%22%20width=%22687%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E[Figure%203:%20Latency%20vs%20Throughput%20with%20Different%20Journal%20Device%20in%20Bookie]%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EFigure%203%20shows%20the%20latency%20vs%20performance%20graph%20when%20we%20use%20different%20types%20of%20storage%20devices%20to%20store%20journal%20files.%20It%20illustrates%20that%20the%20Journal%20with%20NVMe%20device%20gives%20350MB%20throughput%20and%20the%20PMEM%20device%20gives%20900MB%20throughput%20by%20maintaining%20consistently%20low%20latency%20p99%205ms.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EAs%20we%20discussed%20earlier,%20this%20benchmark%20testing%20is%20performed%20under%20a%20real%20production%20situation%20and%20the%20test%20was%20performed%20under%20backlog%20conditions.%20Our%20primary%20focus%20for%20this%20test%20is%20(a)%20system%20throughput%20and%20(b)%20system%20latency.%20Most%20of%20the%20applications%20in%20our%20production%20environment%20have%20SLA%20of%20p99%205ms%20publish%20latency.%20Therefore,%20our%20benchmark%20setup%20tests%20throughput%20and%20latency%20of%20Apache%20Pulsar%20with%20various%20storage%20devices%20(HDD,%20SSD,%20NVMe,%20and%20Persistent%20memory)%20and%20with%20a%20mixed%20workload%20of%20writes,%20tail%20reads,%20and%20random%20cold%20reads%20across%20multiple%20topics.%20In%20the%20next%20section,%20let%E2%80%99s%20discuss%20the%20benchmark%20test%20setup%20and%20performance%20results%20in%20detail.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3EBenchmarking%20Pulsar%20Performance%20for%20Production%20Use%20Cases%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWorkload%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3E&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWe%20measured%20the%20performance%20of%20Pulsar%20for%20a%20typical%20mixed%20workload%20scenario.%20In%20terms%20of%20throughput,%20higher%20numbers%20are%20achievable%20(up%20to%20the%20network%20limit),%20but%20those%20numbers%20don't%20help%20in%20decision-making%20for%20building%20production%20systems.%20There%20is%20no%20one-size-fits-all%20recommended%20configuration%20available%20for%20any%20system.%20The%20configuration%20depends%20on%20various%20factors%20such%20as%20hardware%20resources%20of%20brokers%20(memory,%20CPU,%20network%20bandwidth,%20etc.)%20and%20bookies%20(storage%20disk%20types,%20network%20bandwidth,%20memory,%20CPU,%20etc.),%20replication%20configurations%20(ensembleSize,%20writeQuorum,%20ackQuorum),%20traffic%20pattern,%20etc.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThe%20benchmark%20test%20configuration%20is%20set%20up%20to%20fully%20utilize%20system%20capabilities.&nbsp;Pulsar%20benchmark%20test%20includes%20various%20configurations%20such%20as%20a%20number%20of%20topics,%20message%20size,%20number%20of%20producers,%20and%20consumer%20processes.%20More%20importantly,%20we%20make%20an%20effort%20to%20ensure%20that%20cold-reads%20occur,%20which%20forces%20the%20system%20to%20read%20messages%20from%20the%20disk.%20This%20is%20typical%20for%20systems%20that%20do%20a%20replay,%20have%20downstream%20outages,%20and%20have%20multiple%20use%20cases%20with%20different%20consumption%20patterns.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EIn%20Verizon%20Media%20(Yahoo),%20most%20of%20our%20use%20cases%20are%20latency-sensitive%20and%20they%20have%20a%20publish%20latency%20SLA%20of%20p99%205ms.&nbsp;Hence%20these%20results%20are%20indicative%20of%20the%20throughput%20limits%20with%20that%20p99%20limit,%20and%20not%20the%20absolute%20throughput%20that%20can%20be%20achieved%20with%20the%20setup.%20We%20evaluated%20the%20performance%20of%20Pulsar%20using%20different%20types%20of%20storage%20devices%20(HDD,%20SSD,%20NVMe,%20and%20PMEM)%20for%20BookKeeper%20Journal%20devices.%20However,%20NVMe%20and%20PMEM%20are%20more%20relevant%20to%20current%20storage%20technology%20trends.%20Therefore,%20our%20benchmark%20setup%20and%20results%20will%20be%20more%20focused%20on%20NVMe%20and%20PMEM%20to%20use%20them%20for%20BookKeeper%20journal%20devices.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EQuorum%20Count,%20Write%20Availability,%20and%20Device%20Tail%20Latencies%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EPulsar%20has%20various%20settings%20to%20ensure%20durability%20vs%20availability%20tradeoffs.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EUnlike%20other%20messaging%20systems,%20Pulsar%20does%20not%20halt%20writes%20to%20do%20recovery%20in%20a%20w=2/a=2%20setup.&nbsp;It%20does%20not%20require&nbsp;a%20w=3/a=2%20setup%20to%20ensure%20write%20availability%20during%20upgrades%20or%20single%20node%20failure.&nbsp;Writing%20to%202%20nodes%20(writeQuorum=2)%20and%20waiting%20for%202%20acknowledgements%20(ackQuorum=2),%20provides%20write%20availability%20in%20Pulsar%20under%20those%20scenarios.&nbsp;In%20this%20setup%20(w=2/a=2),&nbsp;%20when%20a%20single%20node%20fails,%20writes%20can%20proceed%20%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cem%3E%3Cspan%3Ewithout%20interruption%3C/span%3E%3C/em%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3Cspan%3E%20instantaneously,%20while%20recovery%20executes%20in%20the%20background%20to%20restore%20the%20replication%20factor.&nbsp;&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EOther%20messaging%20systems%20halt%20writes,%20while%20doing%20recovery%20under%20these%20scenarios.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWhile%20failure%20may%20be%20rare,%20the%20much%20more%20common%20scenario%20of%20a%20rolling%20upgrade%20is%20seamlessly%20possible%20with%20a%20Pulsar%20configuration%20of%20(w=2/a=2).&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWe%20consider%20this%20a%20marked%20benefit%20out%20of%20the%20box,%20as%20we%20are%20able%20to%20get%20by%20with%20a%20data%20replication%20factor%20of%202%20instead%20of%203%20to%20handle%20these%20occasions,%20with%20storage%20provisioned%20for%202%20copies.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3ETest%20Setup&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EWe%20use%203%20Brokers,%203%20Bookies,%20and%203%20application%20clients.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EApplication%20Configuration:&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E3%20Namespaces,%20150%20Topics%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EProducer%20payload%20100KB%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EConsumers:%20100%20Topics%20with%20consumers%20doing%20hot%20reads,%2050%20topics%20with%20consumers%20doing%20cold%20reads%20(disk%20access)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EBroker%20Configuration:&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E96GB%20RAM,%2025Gb%20NIC&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EPulsar%20settings:%20bookkeeperNumberOfChannelsPerBookie=200%20[4]%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJVM%20settings:%20-XXMaxDirectMemorySize=60g%20-Xmx30g&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EBookie%20Configuration:%201%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E(Journal%20Device:%20NVMe(Device-1),%20Ledger/Data%20Device:%20NVMe(Device-2))%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E64GB%20RAM,%2025Gb%20NIC%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EBookkeeperNumberofChannelsperbookie=200%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJournal%20disk:%20Micron%20NVMe%20SSD%209300%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJournal%20directories:%202%20(Bookie%20configuration:%20journalDirectories)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EData%20disk:%20Micron%20NVMe%20SSD%209300%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ELedger%20directories:%202%20(Bookie%20configuration:%20ledgerDirectories)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJVM%20settings:%20-XXMaxDirectMemorySize=30g%20-Xmx30g&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EBookie%20Configuration:%202%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E(Journal%20Device:%20PMEM,%20Ledger/Data%20Device:%20NVMe)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E64GB%20RAM,%2025Gb%20NIC%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EBookkeeperNumberofChannelsperbookie=200%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EPMEM%20journal%20device:%202%20DIIMs,%20each%20with%20120GB,%20mounted%20as%202%20devices%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJournal%20directories:%204&nbsp;%20(2%20on%20each%20device)%20(Bookie%20configuration:%20journalDirectories)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EData%20disk:%20Micron%20NVMe%20SSD%209300%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3ELedger%20directories:%202&nbsp;%20(Bookie%20configuration:%20ledgerDirectories)%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EJVM%20settings:%20-XXMaxDirectMemorySize=30g%20-Xmx30g&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3EClient%20Setup&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThe%20Pulsar%20performance%20tool[3]:%20was%20used%20to%20run%20the%20benchmark%20test.&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3EResults%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThe%20performance%20test%20was%20performed%20on%20two%20separate%20Bookie%20configurations:%20Bookie%20configuration-1%20uses%20two%20separate%20NVMe%20each%20for%20Journal%20and%20Data%20device%20and%20Bookie%20configuration-2%20uses%20PMEM%20as%20Journal%20and%20NVMe%20as%20a%20Device%20device.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Pulsar%20Performance%20Evaluation%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%223c66eacb-d172-4299-a7dd-27cefcfa38bf%22%20height=%22221%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/Screen%20Shot%202021-06-10%20at%203.20.57%20PM.png%22%20width=%22720%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E[Table%204:%20Pulsar%20Performance%20Evaluation]%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EAs%20noted%20before,%20read/write%20latency%20variations%20occur%20when%20an%20NVMe%20SSD%20controller%20is%20busy%20with%20media%20management%20tasks%20such%20as%20Garbage%20Collection,%20Wear%20Leveling,%20etc.%20The%20p99%20NVMe%20disk%20latency%20goes%20high%20with%20certain%20workloads,%20and%20that%20impacts%20the%20Pulsar%20p99%20latency,%20under%20a&nbsp;replication%20configuration:%20e=2,%20w=2,%20a=2.%20&nbsp;%20(The%20p95%20NVMe%20disk%20latency%20is%20not%20affected,%20and%20so%20Pulsar%2095%20latencies%20are%20still%20under%205ms%20)&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThe%20impact%20of%20the%20NVME%20wear%20leveling%20and%20garbage%20collection%20can%20be%20mitigated%20by%20a%20replication%20configuration%20of%20e=3,%20w=3,%20and%20a=2,%20which%20helps%20flatten%20out%20the%20pulsar%20p99%20latency%20graph%20across%203%20bookies%20and%20achieves%20higher%20throughput%20while%20maintaining%20low%205ms%20p99%20latency.%20We%20don%E2%80%99t%20see%20such%20improvements%20in%20the%20PMEM%20journal%20device%20set%20up%20with%20such%20a%20replication%20configuration.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EThe%20results%20demonstrate%20that%20Bookie%20with%20NVMe%20or%20PMEM%20storage%20devices%20gives%20fairly%20high%20throughput%20at%20around%20900MB%20by%20maintaining%20low%205ms%20p99%20latency.%20While%20performing%20benchmark%20tests%20on%20NVMe%20journal%20device%20setup%20with%20replication%20configuration%20e=3,w=3,ack=2,%20we%20have%20captured%20io-stats%20of%20each%20bookie.%20Figure%205%20shows%20that%20Bookie%20with%20a%20PMEM%20device%20provides%20900MB%20write%20throughput%20with%20consistent%20low%20latency%20(%20&lt;%205ms).%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Latency%20Vs%20Time%20(PMEM%20Journal%20device%20with%20900MB%20throughput%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%22cb5267cf-1bc2-43bc-858b-faa7e4c4496c%22%20height=%22361%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/image4_1.png%22%20width=%22677%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E[Figure%205:%20Latency%20Vs%20Time%20(PMEM%20Journal%20Device%20with%20900MB%20Throughput)]%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3E&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Figure%206:%20Pulsar%20Bookie%20IO%20stats%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%22774a22ab-b204-4224-b897-593241f4907d%22%20height=%22419%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/image1_5.png%22%20width=%22677%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E[Figure%206:%20Pulsar%20Bookie%20IO%20Stats]%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3EIO%20stats%20(Figure%206)%20shows%20that%20the%20journal%20device%20serves%20around%20900MB%20writes%20and%20no%20reads.%20Data%20device%20also%20serves%20900MB%20avg%20writes%20while%20serving%20350MB%20reads%20from%20each%20bookie.%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cspan%3EPerformance%20&amp;&nbsp;User%20Impact&nbsp;%3C/span%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3EThe%20potential%20user%20impact%20of%20software-defined%20storage%20is%20best%20understood%20in%20the%20context%20of%20the%20performance,%20scale,%20and%20latency%20that%20characterize%20most%20distributed%20systems%20today.%20You%20can%20determine%20if%20a%20software%20solution%20is%20using%20storage%20resources%20optimally%20in%20several%20different%20ways,%20and%20two%20important%20metrics%20are%20throughput%20and%20latency.%20We%20have%20been%20using%20Bookies%20with%20PMEM%20journal%20devices%20in%20production%20for%20some%20time%20by%20replacing%20HDD-RAID%20devices.%20Figure%207%20shows%20the%20write%20throughput%20vs%20latency%20bucket%20graph%20for%20Bookies%20with%20HDD-RAID%20journal%20device%20and%20Figure%208%20shows%20for%20PMEM%20journal%20device.%20Bookies%20with%20HDD-RAID%20configuration%20have%20high%20write%20latency%20with%20the%20spike%20in%20traffic%20and%20it%20shows%20that%20requests%20having%20&gt;%2050ms%20write-latency%20increase%20with%20the%20higher%20traffic.%20On%20the%20other%20hand,%20Bookies%20with%20PMEM%20journal%20device%20provides%20stable%20and%20consistent%20low%20latency%20with%20higher%20traffic%20and%20serves%20user%20requests%20within%20SLA.%20These%20graphs%20explain%20the%20user%20impact%20of%20PMEM%20which%20allows%20Bookies%20to%20serve%20latency-sensitive%20applications%20and%20meet%20their%20SLA%20with%20the%20spike%20in%20traffic%20as%20well.%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3Cbr%20/%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Figure%207.%20Bookie%20publish%20latency%20buckets%20with%20HDD-RAID%20Bookie%20journal%20device%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%2223cf8e42-1a94-457d-9ed2-46ea197a3efe%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/image2_3.png%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan%3E%3Cspan%3E[Figure%207.%20Bookie%20Publish%20Latency%20Buckets%20with%20HDD-RAID%20Bookie%20Journal%20Device]%3C/span%3E%3C/span%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E&nbsp;%3C/p%3E%3Cimg%20alt=%22Figure%208.%20Bookie%20publish%20latency%20buckets%20with%20PMEM%20Bookie%20journal%20device%22%20data-align=%22center%22%20data-entity-type=%22file%22%20data-entity-uuid=%2299b8e41f-1334-432f-a618-b8897dd6119a%22%20src=%22https://edgecast-production-backyard-verizonmedia-com.s3.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/verizonmedia/s3fs-public/inline-images/image5_2.png%22%20/%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cspan lts%20showed%20Storm%20to%20be%20among%20the%20best.%20We%20expect%20to%20release%20new%20numbers%20by%20the%20end%20of%20June%202019,%20but%20in%20the%20interim,%20we%20ran%20some%20smaller%20Storm%20specific%20tests%20that%20we%E2%80%99d%20like%20to%20share.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EStorm%202.0%20has%20a%20built-in%20load%20generation%20tool%20under%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/apache/storm/tree/v2.0.0/examples/storm-loadgen%22%3Eexamples/storm-loadgen%3C/a%3E.%20It%20comes%20with%20the%20requisite%20word%20count%20test,%20which%20we%20used%20here,%20but%20also%20has%20the%20ability%20to%20capture%20a%20statistical%20representation%20of%20the%20bolts%20and%20spouts%20in%20a%20running%20production%20topology%20and%20replay%20that%20load%20on%20another%20topology,%20or%20another%20version%20of%20Storm.%20For%20this%20test,%20we%20backported%20that%20code%20to%20Storm%201.2.2.%20We%20then%20ran%20the%20ThroughputVsLatency%20test%20on%20both%20code%20bases%20at%20various%20throughputs%20and%20different%20numbers%20of%20workers%20to%20see%20what%20impact%20Storm%202.0%20would%20have.%20These%20were%20run%20out%20of%20the%20box%20with%20no%20tuning%20to%20the%20default%20parameters,%20except%20to%20set%20max.spout.pending%20in%20the%20topologies%20to%20be%201000%20sentences,%20as%20in%20the%20past%20that%20has%20proven%20to%20be%20a%20good%20balance%20between%20throughput%20and%20latency%20while%20providing%20flow%20control%20in%20the%201.2.2%20version%20that%20lacks%20backpressure.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20general,%20for%20a%20WordCount%20topology,%20we%20noticed%2050%%20-%2080%%20improvements%20in%20latency%20for%20processing%20a%20full%20sentence.%20Moreover,%2099%20percentile%20latency%20in%20most%20cases,%20is%20lower%20than%20the%20mean%20latency%20in%20the%201.2.2%20version.%20We%20also%20saw%20the%20maximum%20throughput%20on%20the%20same%20hardware%20more%20than%20double.%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221474%22%20data-orig-height=%22912%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/3f630f757d60a09d5f50c78938262b61/tumblr_inline_pscc4bXpK91wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221474%22%20data-orig-height=%22912%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221474%22%20data-orig-height=%22912%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/5489f1a2c3610b92bc6aa75b652bc4a2/tumblr_inline_pscc4ptVJp1wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221474%22%20data-orig-height=%22912%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3EWhy%20did%20this%20happen?%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-2306%22%3ESTORM-2306%3C/a%3E%20redesigned%20the%20threading%20model%20in%20the%20workers,%20replaced%20disruptor%20queues%20with%20JCTools%20queues,%20added%20in%20a%20new%20true%20backpressure%20mechanism,%20and%20optimized%20a%20lot%20of%20code%20paths%20to%20reduce%20the%20overhead%20of%20the%20system.%20The%20impact%20on%20system%20resources%20is%20very%20promising.%20Memory%20usage%20was%20untouched,%20but%20CPU%20usage%20was%20a%20bit%20more%20nuanced.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221476%22%20data-orig-height=%22742%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/bcf248c89ef30fead19c2c7026760859/tumblr_inline_pscc6jlcda1wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221476%22%20data-orig-height=%22742%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%221480%22%20data-orig-height=%22742%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/fb19471c08cfb2192676aafd0106861c/tumblr_inline_pscc5vLKFQ1wxhpzr_540.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%221480%22%20data-orig-height=%22742%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20low%20throughput%20(&lt;%208000%20sentences%20per%20second)%20the%20new%20system%20uses%20more%20CPU%20than%20before.%20This%20can%20be%20tuned%20as%20the%20system%20does%20not%20auto-tune%20itself%20yet.%20At%20higher%20rates,%20the%20slope%20of%20the%20line%20is%20much%20lower%20which%20means%20Storm%20has%20less%20overhead%20than%20before%20resulting%20in%20being%20able%20to%20process%20more%20data%20with%20the%20same%20hardware.%20This%20also%20means%20that%20we%20were%20able%20to%20max%20out%20each%20of%20these%20configurations%20at%20&gt;%20100,000%20sentences%20per%20second%20on%202.0.0%20which%20is%20over%202x%20the%20maximum%2045,000%20sentences%20per%20second%20that%201.2.2%20could%20do%20with%20the%20same%20setup.%20Note%20that%20we%20did%20nothing%20to%20tune%20these%20topologies%20on%20either%20setup.%20With%20true%20backpressure,%20a%20WordCount%20Topology%20could%20consistently%20process%20230,000%20sentences%20per%20second%20by%20disabling%20the%20event%20tracking%20feature.%20Due%20to%20true%20backpressure,%20when%20we%20disabled%20it%20entirely,%20then%20we%20were%20able%20to%20achieve%20over%20230,000%20sentences%20per%20second%20in%20a%20stable%20way,%20which%20equates%20to%20over%202%20million%20messages%20per%20second%20being%20processed%20on%20a%20single%20node.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EScalability%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%202.0,%20we%20have%20laid%20the%20groundwork%20to%20make%20Storm%20even%20more%20scalable.%20Workers%20and%20supervisors%20can%20now%20heartbeat%20directly%20into%20Nimbus%20instead%20of%20going%20through%20ZooKeeper,%20resulting%20in%20the%20ability%20to%20run%20much%20larger%20clusters%20out%20of%20the%20box.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EDeveloper%20Friendly%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EPrior%20to%202.0,%20Storm%20was%20primarily%20written%20in%20Clojure.%20Clojure%20is%20a%20wonderful%20language%20with%20many%20advantages%20over%20pure%20Java,%20but%20its%20prevalence%20in%20Storm%20became%20a%20hindrance%20for%20many%20developers%20who%20weren%E2%80%99t%20very%20familiar%20with%20it%20and%20didn%E2%80%99t%20have%20the%20time%20to%20learn%20it.%20%C2%A0Due%20to%20this,%20the%20community%20decided%20to%20port%20all%20of%20the%20daemon%20processes%20over%20to%20pure%20Java.%20We%20still%20maintain%20a%20backward%20compatible%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/apache/storm/tree/v2.0.0/storm-clojure%22%3Estorm-clojure%3C/a%3E%20package%20for%20those%20that%20want%20to%20continue%20using%20Clojure%20for%20topologies.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ESplit%20Classpath%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20older%20versions,%20Storm%20was%20a%20single%20jar,%20that%20included%20code%20for%20the%20daemons%20as%20well%20as%20the%20user%20code.%20We%20have%20now%20split%20this%20up%20and%20storm-client%20provides%20everything%20needed%20for%20your%20topology%20to%20run.%20Storm-core%20can%20still%20be%20used%20as%20a%20dependency%20for%20tests%20that%20want%20to%20run%20a%20local%20mode%20cluster,%20but%20it%20will%20pull%20in%20more%20dependencies%20than%20you%20might%20expect.%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20upgrade%20your%20topology%20to%202.0,%20you%E2%80%99ll%20just%20need%20to%20switch%20your%20dependency%20from%20storm-core-1.2.2%20to%20storm-client-2.0.0%20and%20recompile.%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EBackward%20Compatible%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EEven%20though%20Storm%202.0%20is%20API%20compatible%20with%20older%20versions,%20it%20can%20be%20difficult%20when%20running%20a%20hosted%20multi-tenant%20cluster.%20Coordinating%20upgrading%20the%20cluster%20with%20recompiling%20all%20of%20the%20topologies%20can%20be%20a%20massive%20task.%20Starting%20in%202.0.0,%20Storm%20has%20the%20option%20to%20run%20workers%20for%20topologies%20submitted%20with%20an%20older%20version%20with%20a%20classpath%20for%20a%20compatible%20older%20version%20of%20Storm.%20This%20important%20feature%20which%20was%20developed%20by%20our%20team,%20allows%20you%20to%20upgrade%20your%20cluster%20to%202.0%20while%20still%20allowing%20for%20upgrading%20your%20topologies%20whenever%20they%E2%80%99re%20recompiled%20to%20use%20newer%20dependencies.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3E%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3C 8

0read,%20write,%20and%20read-modify-write,%20as%20well%20as%20(non-atomic)%20range%20query%20(scan)%20operations,%20both%20forward%20and%20backward.%20OakMap%20is%20optimized%20for%20big%20keys%20and%20values,%20in%20particular,%20for%20incremental%20maintenance%20of%20objects%20(update%20in-place).%20It%20is%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Oak/wiki/Performance-Evaluation%22%3Efaster%20and%20scales%20better%3C/a%3E%20with%20additional%20CPU%20cores%20than%20the%20popular%20Java%E2%80%99s%20ConcurrentNavigableMap%20implementation%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/ConcurrentSkipListMap.html%22%3E%20ConcurrentSkipListMap%3C/a%3E.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOak%20data%20is%20written%20to%20the%20off-heap%20buffers,%20thus%20needs%20to%20be%20serialized%20(converting%20an%20object%20in%20memory%20into%20a%20stream%20of%20bytes).%20For%20retrieval,%20data%20might%20be%20deserialized%20(object%20created%20from%20the%20stream%20of%20bytes).%20In%20addition,%20to%20save%20the%20cycles%20spent%20on%20deserialization,%20we%20allow%20reading/updating%20the%20data%20directly%20via%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Oak#oak-buffers%22%3EOakBuffers%3C/a%3E.%20Oak%20provides%20this%20functionality%20under%20the%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Oak#data-retrieval%22%3EZeroCopy%20API%3C/a%3E.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIf%20you%20aren%E2%80%99t%20already%20familiar%20with%20Oak,%20this%20is%20an%20excellent%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/Oak#install%22%3Estarting%20point%20to%20use%20it%3C/a%3E!%20Check%20it%20out%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22mailto:anastas@verizonmedia.com%22%3Elet%20us%20know%3C/a%3E%20if%20you%20have%20any%20questions.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EOak%20keeps%20getting%20better:%20Introducing%20Oak0.2%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20have%20made%20a%20ton%20of%20great%20improvements%20to%20Oak0.2,%20adding%20a%20new%20stream%20scanning%20for%20improved%20performance,%20releasing%20a%20ground-up%20rewrite%20of%20our% ous%20reading%20of%20the%20wrong%20data,%20unintentional%20corrupting%20of%20the%20data,%20etc.%20We%20couldn%E2%80%99t%20choose%20between%20safety%20and%20performance,%20so%20strived%20to%20have%20both!%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20Oak0.2,%20ByteBuffer%20is%20never%20exposed%20to%20the%20user.%20Users%20can%20choose%20to%20work%20either%20with%20OakBuffer%20which%20is%20safe%20or%20with%20OakUnsafeDirectBuffer%20which%20gives%20you%20faster%20access,%20but%20use%20it%20carefully.%20With%20OakUnsafeDirectBuffer,%20it%20is%20the%20user&rsquo;s%20responsibility%20to%20synchronize%20and%20not%20to%20access%20deleted%20data,%20if%20the%20user%20is%20aware%20of%20those%20issues,%20OakUnsafeDirectBuffer%20is%20safe%20as%20well.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EOur%20safe%20OakBuffer%20works%20with%20the%20same,%20great%20and%20known,%20OakMap%20performance,%20which%20wasn%E2%80%99t%20easy%20to%20achieve.%20However,%20if%20the%20user%20is%20interested%20in%20even%20superior%20speed%20of%20operations,%20any%20OakBuffer%20can%20be%20cast%20to%20OakUnsafeDirectBuffer.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cfigure%20data-orig-width=%22442%22%20data-orig-height=%22387%22%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://64.media.tumblr.com/8e05052b8398d65ae55c3ca9ee93be76/813196bd531067cb-59/s540x810/7069582b6c8a98baa9c47d77491dade45904a060.png%22%20alt=%22image%22%20data-orig-width=%22442%22%20data-orig-height=%22387%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3ELess%20(metadata)%20is%20more%20(data)%3C/b%3E%3Cbr/%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20the%20initial%20version%20of%20OakMap%20we%20had%20an%20object%20named%20handler%20that%20was%20a%20gateway%20to%20access%20any%20value.%20Handler%20was%20used%20for%20synchronization%20and%20memory%20management.%20Handler%20took%20about%20256%20bytes%20per%20each%20value%20and%20imposed%20dereferencing%20on%20each%20value%20access.%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EHandler%20is%20now%20replaced%20with%20an%208-bytes%20header%20located%20in%20the%20off-heap,%20next%20to%20the%20value.%20No%20dereferencing%20is%20needed. %3E%3Cp%3EWe%20added%20a%20possibility%20to%20reuse%20the%20deleted%20headers%20for%20new%20values,%20by%20introducing%20a%20sophisticated%20memory%20management%20and%20locking%20mechanism.%20Therefore%20the%20new%20values%20can%20use%20the%20place%20of%20the%20old%20deleted%20value.%20With%20Oak0.2,%20the%20scenario%20of%2050%%20puts%20and%2050%%20deletes%20is%20running%20with%20a%20stable%20amount%20of%20memory%20and%20performs%20twice%20better%20than%20CSLM.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20look%20forward%20to%20growing%20the%20Oak%20community!%20We%20invite%20you%20to%20explore%20the%20project,%20use%20OakMap%20in%20your%20applications,%20raise%20issues,%20suggest%20improvements,%20and%20contribute%20code.%20If%20you%20have%20any%20questions,%20please%20feel%20free%20to%20send%20us%20a%20%3Ca%20href=%22mailto:anastas@verizonmedia.com%22%3Enote%3C/a%3E.%20It%20would%20be%20great%20to%20hear%20from%20you!%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EAcknowledgements:%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/liran-funaro-6752a737/%22%3ELiran%20Funaro%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/eshcar/%22%3EEshcar%20Hilel%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/eranmeirsw/%22%3EEran%20Meir%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/yoavzuriel/%22%3EYoav%20Zuriel%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/ebortnik/%22%3EEdward%20Bortnikov%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://www.linkedin.com/in/yonigottesman/%22%3EYonatan%20Gottesman%3C/a%3E%3C/p%3E,https://yahoodevelopers.tumblr.com/post/625718101175042049

%3E%3Cp%3EAt%20Yahoo,%20we%20have%20invested%20heavily%20in%20a%20number%20of%20open%20source%20big%20data%20platforms%20that%20we%20use%20daily%20to%20support%20our%20business.%20For%20streaming%20workloads,%20our%20platform%20of%20choice%20has%20been%20Apache%20Storm,%20which%20replaced%20our%20internally%20developed%20S4%20platform.%20We%20have%20been%20using%20Storm%20extensively,%20and%20the%20number%20of%20nodes%20running%20Storm%20at%20Yahoo%20has%20now%20reached%20about%202,300%20(and%20is%20still%20growing).%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ESince%20our%20initial%20decision%20to%20use%20Storm%20in%202012,%20the%20streaming%20landscape%20has%20changed%20drastically.%20There%20are%20now%20several%20other%20noteworthy%20competitors%20including%20Apache%20Flink,%20Apache%20Spark%20(Spark%20Streaming),%20Apache%20Samza,%20Apache%20Apex%20and%20Google%20Cloud%20Dataflow.%20There%20is%20increasing%20confusion%20over%20which%20package%20offers%20the%20best%20set%20of%20features%20and%20which%20one%20performs%20better%20under%20which%20conditions%20(for%20instance%20see%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://www.altaterra.net/blogpost/288668/225612/Which-Stream-Processing-Engine-Storm-Spark-Samza-or-Flink%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3Ca%20href=%22http://www.altaterra.net/blogpost/288668/225612/Which-Stream-Processing-Engine-Storm-Spark-Samza-or-Flink%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ehere%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://data-artisans.com/high-throughput-low-latency-and-exactly-once-stream-processing-with-apache-flink/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ehere%3C/a%3E,%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://tsicilian.wordpress.com/2015/02/16/streaming-big-data-storm-spark-and-samza/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3E%3C/a%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://tsicilian.wordpress.com/2015/02/16/streaming-big-data-storm-spark-and-samza/%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ehere%3C/a%3E,%20and%20%3Ca%20href=%22http://www.altaterra.net/blogpost/288668/225578/Open-Source-Packages-and-NoSQL-Now-Conference-in-San-Jose-Part-2?hhSearchTerms=%22flink%22&amp;terms=%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ehere%3C/a%3E).%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ETo%20provide%20the%20best%20streaming%20tools%20to%20our%20internal%20customers,%20we%20wanted%20to%20know%20what%20Storm%20is%20good%20at%20and%20where%20it%20needs%20to%20be%20improved%20compared%20to%20other%20systems.%20To%20do%20this%20we%20started%20to%20look%20for%20stream%20processing%20benchmarks%20that%20we%20could%20use%20to%20do%20this%20evaluation,%20but%20all%20of%20them%20were%20lacking%20in%20several%20fundamental%20areas.%20Primarily,%20they%20did%20not%20test%20with%20anything%20close%20to%20a%20real%20world%20use%20case.%20So%20we%20decided%20to%20write%20one%20and%20released%20it%20as%20open%20source%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/streaming-benchmarks%22%20target=%22_blank%22%3Ehttps://github.com/yahoo/streaming-benchmarks%3C/a%3E.%C2%A0%20In%20our%20initial%20evaluation%20we%20decided%20to%20limit%20our%20test%20to%20three%20of%20the%20most%20popular%20and%20promising%20platforms%20(Storm,%20Flink%20and%20Spark),%20but%20welcome%20contributions%20for%20other%20systems,%20and%20to%20expand%20the%20scope%20of%20the%20benchmark.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3E%3Cb%3EBenchmark%20Design%3C/b%3E%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20benchmark%20is%20a%20simple%20advertisement%20application.%20There%20are%20a%20number%20of%20advertising%20campaigns,%20and%20a%20number%20of%20advertisements%20for%20each%20campaign.%20The%20job%20of%20the%20benchmark%20is%20to%20read%20various%20JSON%20events%20from%20Kafka,%20identify%20the%20relevant%20events,%20and%20store%20a%20windowed%20count%20of%20relevant%20events%20per%20campaign%20into%20Redis.%20These%20steps%20attempt%20to%20probe%20some%20common%20operations%20performed%20on%20data%20streams.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20flow%20of%20operations%20is%20as%20follows%20(and%20shown%20in%20the%20following%20figure):%3C/p%3E%3Col%3E%3Cli%3ERead%20an%20event%20from%20Kafka.%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EDeserialize%20the%20JSON%20string.%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3EFilter%20out%20irrelevant%20events%20(based%20o
