egarding%20external%20API%20for%20autosuggest%20we%20use%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://blog.cloudflare.com/introducing-cloudflare-workers/%22%3ECloudflare%20Workers%3C/a%3E%20(supporting%20Javascript%20on%20V8%20and%20later%20perhaps%20multiple%20languages%20with%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://webassembly.org%22%3EWebassembly%3C/a%3E)%20to%20handle%20API%20queries%20from%20Zedge%20apps%20in%20front%20of%20Vespa%20running%20in%20Google%20Cloud.%20This%20setup%20allow%20for%20simple%20close-to-user%20caching%20of%20autosuggest%20results.%20%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3ESearch,%20Recommenders%20and%20Related%20Content%20with%20Vespa%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EWithout%20going%20into%20details%20we%20had%20several%20recommender%20and%20search%20services%20to%20adapt%20to%20Vespa.%20These%20services%20were%20adapted%20by%20writing%20custom%20Vespa%20searchers%20and%20in%20some%20cases%20search%20chains:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%22%3Ehttps://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/searcher-development.html%3C/a%3E%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/chained-components.html%22%3Ehttps://docs.vespa.ai/documentation/chained-components.html%3C/a%3E%C2%A0%3Cbr/%3E%3C/li%3E%3C/ul%3E%3Cp%3EThe%20main%20change%20compared%20to%20our%20old%20recommender%20and%20related%20content%20services%20was%20the%20degree%20of%20dynamicity%20and%20freshness%20of%20serving,%20i.e.%20with%20Vespa%20more%20ranking%20signals%20are%20calculated%20on%20the%20fly%20using%20Vespa%E2%80%99s%20tensor%20support%20instead%20of%20being%20precalculated%20and%20fed%20into%20services%20periodically.%20Another%20benefit%20of%20this%20was%20that%20the%20amount%20of%20computational%20(big%20data)%20resources%20and%20code%20for%20recommender%20&amp;%20related%20content%20processing%20was%20heavily%20reduced.%3C/p%3E%3Ch4%3EContinuous%20Integration%20and%20Testing%20with%20Vespa%3C/h4%3E%3Cp%3EA%20main%20focus%20was%20to%20make%20testing%20and% 0experiments%20in%20parallel%20resulted%20in%20additional%20branching%20and%20bloating%20of%20our%20JavaScript%20and%20CSS%20code.%20While%20rewriting%20all%20of%20our%20code,%20we%20solved%20this%20issue%20using%20%3Cb%3EMendel%3C/b%3E,%20our%20homegrown%20solution%20for%20bucket%20testing%20isomorphic%20web%20apps,%20which%20we%20have%20%3Ca%20href=%22https://github.com/yahoo/mendel%22%3Eopen%20sourced%3C/a%3E.%20%C2%A0%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ERather%20than%20using%20custom%20libraries,%20we%20use%20%3Cb%3Enative%20HTML5%20APIs%20and%20ES6%3C/b%3E%20heavily%20and%20use%20PolyesterJS,%20our%20homegrown%20polyfill%20solution,%20to%20fill%20the%20gaps.%20These%20factors%20have%20further%20helped%20us%20to%20keep%20payload%20size%20minimal.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20all%20the%20above%20optimizations,%20we%20have%20been%20able%20to%20reduce%20our%20JavaScript%20and%20CSS%20footprint%20by%20approximately%2050%%20compared%20to%20the%20previous%20desktop%20version%20of%20Yahoo%20Mail,%20helping%20us%20achieve%20a%20blazing-fast%20launch.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EIn%20addition%20to%20initial%20launch%20improvements,%20key%20features%20like%20search%20and%20message%20read%20(when%20a%20user%20opens%20an%20email%20to%20read%20it)%20have%20also%20benefited%20from%20the%20above%20optimizations%20and%20are%20considerably%20faster%20in%20the%20latest%20version%20of%20Yahoo%20Mail.%20%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWe%20also%20significantly%20reduced%20the%20memory%20consumed%20by%20Yahoo%20Mail%20on%20the%20browser.%20This%20is%20especially%20noticeable%20during%20a%20long%20running%20session.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3E%3Cb%3EReliability%3C/b%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EWith%20this%20new%20version%20of%20Yahoo%20Mail,%20we%20have%20a%2099.99%%20success%20rate%20on%20core%20flows:%20launch,%20message%20read,%20compose,%20search,%20and%20actions%20that%20affect%20messages.%20Accomplishing%20this%20over%20several%20billion%20user%20actions%20a%20day%20is%20a%20significant%20feat.%20Client-side%20errors%20(JavaScript%20exceptions)%20are%20reduc order%20and%20only%20a%20reasonable%20amount%20of%20logs%20is%20fetched%20and%20loaded%20lazily%20as%20the%20user%20scrolls%20up%20the%20log%20console.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3EThis%20change%20is%20meant%20to%20compensate%20for%20builds%20that%20generate%20tens%20of%20thousands%20lines%20of%20log.%20Since%20users%20had%20to%20wait%20for%20the%20entire%20log%20to%20load%20before%20they%20could%20interact%20with%20it,%20the%20previous%20implementation%20was%20extremely%20time%20consuming%20as%20the%20size%20of%20step%20logs%20increased.%3C/p%3E%3Cp%20style=%22text-align:center;%22%3E%3Cfigure%20class=%22tmblr-full%22%20data-orig-height=%22330%22%20data-orig-width=%22453%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1331106/45246743-efbeca00-b2d0-11e8-850f-832710acc6cb.gif%22%3E%3Cimg%20src=%22https://66.media.tumblr.com/c52a40e093e36901ac7ac5a043698d51/tumblr_inline_pghtz0ISKw1rfupki_540.gif%22%20alt=%22lazy%20scroll%20log%22%20data-orig-height=%22330%22%20data-orig-width=%22453%22%20data-orig-src=%22https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1331106/45246743-efbeca00-b2d0-11e8-850f-832710acc6cb.gif%22/%3E%3C/figure%3E%3C/p%3E%3Cp%3ENow,%20the%20first%20page%20of%20a%20step%20log%20takes%20roughly%20two%20seconds%20or%20less%20to%20load.%20To%20put%20the%20significance%20of%20the%20change%20into%20perspective,%20consider%20a%20step%20that%20generates%20a%20total%20of%2098743%20lines%20of%20log:%20it%20would%20have%20taken%2090%20seconds%20to%20load%20and%20almost%2010%20seconds%20to%20fully%20render%20on%20the%20UI;%20now%20it%20takes%20less%20than%202%20seconds%20to%20load%20and%20less%20than%201%20second%20to%20render.%3C/p%3E%3Ch2%3ECompatibility%20List%3C/h2%3E%3Cp%3EThese%20UI%20improvements%20require%20the%20following%20minimum%20versions%20of%20Screwdriver:%3C/p%3E%3Cul%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://hub.docker.com/r/screwdrivercd/screwdriver%22%3Escrewdrivercd/screwdriver%3C/a%3E:%20v0.5.460%3C/li%3E%3Cli%3E%3Ca%20href=%22https://hub.docker.com/r/screw
